Control your calls and data usage
Network is busy. Please try placing your call again later.
Network is congested. Contact your mobile operator for assistance.
Cannot place a call as another outgoing call is already dialling.
Cannot place a call as there is an unanswered incoming call. Answer or reject the incoming call prior to placing a new call.
Cannot place a call as calling has been disabled using the ro.telephony.disable-call system property.
"Can't make outgoing calls while call barring is on."
"A SIM card has activated your service and updated your phone's roaming capabilities."
There are too many active calls. Please end or merge existing calls before placing a new one.
Call ended because mobile data was disabled.
Call ended because the mobile data limit has been reached.

Normal calls restricted by access control.
Emergency calls over Wi-Fi calling not available in this location.
Outgoing calls are restricted by FDN.
Unable to connect. Please insert a valid SIM card.
Video call ended due to low battery.
All available lines are in use. To make a call, disconnect one of the calls on this device or on one of your other devices.
Cannot place a call as the device is currently being provisioned.
Cannot place a call as there are already two calls in progress. Disconnect one of the calls or merge them into a conference prior to placing a new call.
Cannot make video calls when TTY is enabled.
Wi-Fi calling is not available in this location.
Disable blocking of all incoming calls?

Hide my number for outgoing calls (confirm that your carrier supports this feature)

"(Can't use: Must be set as default data SIM)"
"If you select another card as your default for mobile data, you won't be able to use your China Telecom UIM card (except in roaming)."
CDMA call waiting under IMS off
CDMA call waiting under IMS on

Confirm that your network provider supports this function
Looks like you have a 4G only SIM card. To make sure it works normally, set it as default for mobile data. Set now?

Looks like you changed SIM cards. Set this card as your default SIM for your mobile data connection?
Enter your voicemail PIN to continue.
Issue with phone number you are trying to dial. Error code 1.

"Can't change network preferences while using Mi Roaming"
This service requires mobile data connection. Turn it on to continue.
You need to turn off FDN first
"Vibrate when the person you're calling answers your call"
Vibrate when your call is answered
"Can't connect to this network at the moment. Try again later."
Ringtone volume will gradually grow to the level you set
"You won't be able to send and receive MMS if you turn off mobile data (WCDMA/LTE). However, you'll be able to do that when your device is connected to Wi-Fi."
"You'll still be able to send and receive MMS if you turn off mobile data (WCDMA/LTE). To use the internet, connect to Wi-Fi."
Ask whether to use mobile data
Allow this device to use mobile data
Allowing to always use mobile data may generate additional charges outside of your carrier plan. Connect anyway?
"Your device is overheated. Can't use this feature now."
"Looks like your network environment isn't reliable. To improve connection, allow your device to use mobile data during VoLTE calls on the secondary SIM."
Some apps require mobile data connection. You can contact your carrier to learn what %s are available to you.
"Couldn't find SIM %1$s. SIM %2$s is set as your default mobile data card now. Mobile data is now turned off."
"Couldn't find SIM %1$s. SIM %2$s is set as your default mobile data card now. Mobile data is turned off to avoid unnecessary carrier fees."

Your video call cannot be placed due to low battery.
"Can't call. %s is not an emergency number."
"Couldn't change phone number. If this error occurs after you try again, contact your vendor."
Turn off all call forwarding features

"Your operator doesn't support disabling call forwarding when your phone is unreachable."
"Your operator doesn't support disabling call forwarding when your phone doesn't answer."

For this feature to work properly, call forwarding should be turned on on both SIM cards. Check with your carrier for details on call forwarding options and charges.
A network error occurred. Wait a minute or two and try again.
"Forward calls to the other SIM when they can't be accepted"
"Current carrier doesn't support mobile data services."

"If you turn off 2G and are in an area where 2G is the only network available, you won't be able to make any emergency or non-emergency calls. Turn off anyway?"

A network service that diverts all incoming calls and text messages to a specified number. You have to subscribe to this service. You will be charged with monthly fee. Contact the customer centre (%1$d+[Send]) to subscribe or unsubscribe from this service. Enter %2$s+[number to forward calls to][Send] to enable, or %3$s[Send] to disable.

Follow the spoken instructions until you hear that activation is complete.

"If you skip activation, you can't place calls or connect to mobile data networks (though you can connect to Wi-Fi networks). Until you activate your phone, you are asked to activate it each time that you turn it on."

"Can't make calls in the current network"
Turn on to be able to use VoLTE call functionality in VoLTE networks

"This tablet supports VoLTE calls in 4G networks. Make sure the networks that your device is connected to support this functionality. VoLTE services are provided by your carrier. Contact your local carrier to learn whether VoLTE is supported in your area.
If you see _ in your status bar, VoLTE calls aren't available. If you can't make or receive calls, or your calls are interrupted, make sure your network is compatible with VoLTE.
This tablet doesn't have an earpiece. You can switch to hands-free mode or use earphones to make calls."
VoLTE calls provide better quality than regular calls. Send SMS to activate?
This cellular network has not been verified for VoLTE on this device. Turning this feature on might affect battery life, calls, messages, voicemail, and mobile data usage.
"VoLTE calls aren't supported for the mobile data SIM card."
"VoLTE calls aren't supported by the carrier."
Use VoLTE to improve the quality of voice calls
Confirm that your carrier supports this feature before turning on. Otherwise, regular calls might be affected.
China Telecom VoLTE services are only provided in the areas with VoLTE network coverage. VoLTE services are provided by the carrier.
Use VoNR to improve the quality of voice calls
Emergency calls in areas with cellular coverage only

"Emergency calls are not possible via WiFi Calling.
The device switches automatically to a cellular network(2G/3G) to place an emergency call.
Emergency calls are only possible in areas with cellular coverage."
Unsupported message type. Call %s to listen.
"You can make calls using Wi-Fi now. If you're connected to a Wi-Fi network, you'll be able to talk even when you're in the areas with no mobile network coverage."

"Wi-Fi Calling is a service provided by Orange that allows you to make and receive calls via Wi-Fi. This feature can be used in areas with poor mobile network coverage.
To use Wi-Fi Calling, turn it on in Settings > Wi-Fi Calling.
To activate the service, Orange will send you a confirmation message as soon as the service is available. After this, you'll be able to connect to a Wi-Fi network and make calls.
Calls made via Wi-Fi will be charged according to the conditions of your plan.
Whenever this feature is available, the following icon will be shown at the top of your screen."

"If you select to prefer Wi-Fi networks, they'll be used by default to make phone calls. In case you aren't connected to Wi-Fi or the signal is poor, mobile networks will be used to make calls.
If you select to prefer mobile networks, they will be used by default to make phone calls. In case there's no mobile network coverage or the signal is poor, Wi-Fi networks will be used instead."
